decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up Eldrazi creatures onto the battlefield and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. The deck focuses on using cards like Eldrazi Temple, Eye of Ugin, and Lotus Petal to accelerate mana and drop powerful Eldrazi threats like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer. Additionally, cards like Chalice of the Void and Wasteland disrupt the opponent's game plan, while Unclaimed Territory and Cavern of Souls help ensure that Eldrazi spells are easy to cast. Overall, the deck aims to quickly establish a strong board presence and apply pressure to the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent while also disrupting their game plan with counterspells and land destruction. This UR Aggro deck utilizes powerful cards like Lightning Bolt and Dragon's Rage Channeler to apply pressure early on, with support from cards like Brainstorm and Force of Will to protect its threats. With a mix of creatures, burn spells, and disruption, this deck aims to win the game swiftly before the opponent can stabilize.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by utilizing lands and disrupting the opponent's strategy. The deck focuses on accelerating mana production and creating strong land-based threats like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage. It also includes disruptive cards like Wasteland and Pithing Needle to hinder the opponent's plays. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by repeatedly using Life from the Loam to retrieve lands and generate card advantage. Ultimately, the goal is to establish a dominant board presence and control the game until victory is achieved.

The deck revolves around assembling a powerful artifact combo using cards like Mystic Forge, Manifold Key, and Urza's Tower. By ramping up with cards like Grim Monolith and Ancient Tomb, the deck focuses on generating mana quickly to cast game-ending spells like Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, Eye of the Storms. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Pithing Needle and Soul-Guide Lantern to control the board and protect the combo. Overall, the strategy is to quickly assemble the artifact combo and overwhelm the opponent with powerful spells and abilities.

This deck focuses on a combination of aggressive plays and midrange strategies in order to control the board while applying pressure on the opponent. The key concept revolves around utilizing disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while also deploying threats like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to close out the game quickly. Additionally, the deck includes a mix of removal spells and card draw effects to maintain card advantage and keep the opponent on the back foot.

The main idea of this combo Doomsday deck is to utilize cards like Doomsday, Dark Ritual, and Lotus Petal to quickly set up a winning combination of cards that can be used to win the game in a single turn. The deck also includes cards like Ponder, Brainstorm, and Consider to help find and set up the combo pieces, along with disruption spells like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo. With cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Jace, Wielder of Mysteries as alternate win conditions, this deck aims to win the game through a powerful and efficient combo strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to cheat powerful creatures like Emrakul onto the battlefield using the card Show and Tell, while also utilizing Omniscience to cast spells for free. The deck also includes various counterspells and card draw effects to control the game and find the combo pieces needed to win. Through a combination of powerful creatures and spellcasting abilities, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and win the game quickly and decisively.

The deck focuses on creating a high storm count to cast Tendrils of Agony, utilizing cards like Dark Ritual, Lotus Petal, and Lion's Eye Diamond to generate mana quickly. It also utilizes the graveyard as a resource with cards like Echo of Eons and Gaea's Will to recycle cards and draw into more combo pieces. Burning Wish acts as versatile tutor, allowing access to key combo pieces from the sideboard. The deck aims to carefully manage resources and spells to build up a lethal storm count and finish the game in one explosive turn.

The main focus of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to quickly play powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher by utilizing ramp cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Ancient Tomb. This deck also includes disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void to lock down opponents' spells while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Eldrazi Linebreaker and Glaring Fleshraker. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with fast, efficient threats while utilizing Eldrazi Temple and Eye of Ugin to support its powerful creatures.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana using Cloudposts and synergizing with Planar Nexus and Thundertrap Trainer to generate overwhelming advantage. Karn, the Great Creator acts as a versatile threat and toolbox, while The One Ring offers a powerful win condition. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Force of Negation and Force of Will to protect its combo pieces. With a mix of powerful threats and control elements, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with mana advantage and powerful spells.

This deck focuses on swiftly playing aggressive creatures and burning spells against the opponent. By using cards like Dragon's Rage Channeler, Murktide Regent, Lightning Bolt, and Force of Will, the deck aims to pressure the opponent quickly and efficiently. The deck also includes control elements like Force of Will and Daze to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Additionally, it includes lands like Wasteland and Misty Rainforest to control the opponent's resources. The combination of aggression, burn spells, and disruption makes this deck a formidable force in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of powerful creatures, disruptive spells, and card advantage. The deck includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push, card filtering and card draw with Ponder and Brainstorm, and disruptive elements such as Thoughtseize and Narset, Parter of Veils. The deck also features powerful finishers like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Murktide Regent. Overall, this Grixis Control deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent through a mix of efficient threats and answers.

The deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo utilizing Mystic Forge and a variety of artifacts to generate mana efficiently and set up a win condition. The deck includes key cards like Grim Monolith, Karn, the Great Creator, and various artifacts like Mox Opal and Expedition Map to facilitate the combo. The goal is to accelerate mana production, dig through the deck with Mystic Forge, and eventually play a game-winning threat like Glaring Fleshraker or use Karn, the Great Creator's abilities to lock out the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures, then bring them back onto the battlefield using reanimation spells like Reanimate, Shallow Grave, and Animate Dead. The deck also includes cards like Cabal Therapy and Collective Brutality to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect your combo pieces. With the ability to cheat out massive threats like Griselbrand, Borborygmos Enraged, and Archon of Cruelty early in the game, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and win through powerful creature interactions.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the combo of Mystic Forge and Manifold Key to generate infinite mana and spell casts. The deck aims to accelerate its game plan by utilizing Urza's Workshop and Urza's Tower to ramp into the combo pieces quickly. Other cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain provide additional utility and control elements to manage the game state. Overall, the deck focuses on assembling its combo pieces efficiently to overwhelm the opponent and secure the win.

The main concept of this deck is to play aggressively with a focus on tempo and card advantage. It utilizes low-cost spells like Lightning Bolt and Daze to control the board early on, while also using card draw effects like Preordain and Mishra's Bauble to maintain card advantage. The deck includes powerful threats like Murktide Regent and Dragon's Rage Channeler to pressure the opponent and close out the game quickly. Additionally, the deck includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Wasteland to protect its threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan.
